metadata.title: CVE-2020-9369 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
Sympa 6.2.38 through 6.2.52 allows remote attackers to cause a denial ofservice (disk consumption from temporary files, and a flood ofnotifications to listmasters) via a series of requests with malformedparameters.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-9369` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

sympa - 6.2.40~dfsg-4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: sympa package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.2.40~dfsg-4').
